divs: Sighting Details I stopped on a country road to BS a guy who sits and drinks out there. While talking to him I noticed a bright white light moving easterly approximately over the Toutle or Green river south of my location near the cowlitz river. The light proceeded east at a leisurely pace for a little while for a (maybe 20 or 30 second)it then made a slow-sweeping right hand turn to the south and then proceeded south. It went behind a cloud bank and never came out the other side. It may have stopped, making it indistinguishable from a star as they sometimes do. It was nothing spectacular but it's the first one Ive seen in a while. I just like to share this stuff when I see it. Approximate altitude would be stratosphere, way up on the edge of space. Just one of those lights that bebops around up there.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Toledo
This sighting has never been favorited.
